page.title: 11Farming in Whitsbury 2
page.content: In the 1960's the stud farm produced many outstanding horses including at one time or another the winners of all five English Classics.The Whitsbury yearlings have topped the{Newmarket } sales often and, in 1984 10 yearlings realized over Â£500000.There are annually over 150 visiting mares and their offspring, making the Stud a very labour-intensive operation and providing a good deal of local employment. The present studs are{ {Electric}and{Young Generation},one of the best young sires at stud in this country.Whitsbury estate can trace its racing stables back to the 1860's when a small number of National Hunt horses were trained here.From the 1930's it gained recognition as a flat racing stable.An essential feature of this area are the grass gallops,a deep cushion of turf on chalk downland.
